StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Indexing Genes Impacted by Copy Number Variation in Developmental Disorders

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: “The dataset used for the analyses described in this manuscript was obtained from the database of Genotype and Phenotype (dbGaP) found at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap [Accession Number: phs xxxxxx]. Samples and associated genotypic data from the dataset, entitled “Genes Impacted by Copy Number Variation in Developmental Disorders,” were provided by Stephen Scherer, James Stavropoulos and their colleagues at The Centre for Applied Genomics, which is funded by Genome Canada and the Ontario Genomics Institute, the Canada Foundation for Innovation, the University of Toronto McLaughlin Centre and the Hospital for Sick Children.”
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: The use of the "Indexing Genes Impacted by Copy Number Variation in Developmental Disorders" dataset requires local IRB approval. All requestors and data users must provide a local Institutional Review board [IRB] letter from their respective institution approving conduct of the proposed research project. Only full or expedited approvals will be accepted. The IRB letter must explicitly reference the use of the “Indexing Genes Impacted by Copy Number Variation in Developmental Disorders” dataset. The requestor of this dataset agrees to make the results of studies available to the research community. The use of this dataset is limited to genetics studies only by not-for-profit organizations. The annual progress report should cite work done that relates specifically to this dataset [Indexing Genes Impacted by Copy Number Variation in Developmental Disorders] and not just a generic report for a series of datasets that may also have been requested at the same time.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, PUB, NPU, GSO)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB-PUB-NPU-GSO
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.
